thread.title: Potholes on Essex main roads cut by 15% over summer
thread.title_full: Potholes on Essex main roads cut by 15% over summer | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Potholes on Essex main roads cut by 15% over summer
text:
The number of potholes on Essex roads has fallen over the summer.
Between July and September pothole numbers have fallen by 15% on Essex County Council’s Priority 1 routes like the A414, A127 and A133 since the previous quarter.
There's been a bigger drop on lower priority routes - down 32%.
There were just under 260 potholes and other defects on the County’s main roads.
Essex still has more than 4,000 potholes on minor local roads. Credit: ITV News Anglia “During the summer months with reasonable weather, we’ve continued working hard to reduce carriageway defects throughout the Essex road network.
"I’m encouraged by the latest figures which demonstrate sustained progress on roads that are pivotal to Essex’s economy, as well as our local roads.”
– Cllr Eddie Johnson, Essex County Council Good weather over the summer has allowed pothole repairs to be made. Credit: ITV News Anglia Outstanding potholes on local roads have also fallen over the same period, from 4,626 to 4,380, a reduction of 5%.
Since the same period last year, potholes on local roads are down by 18% from 5,464.
Last updated Sun 11 Oct 2015 Travel Potholes Essex
